last_50_posts.content: I’ve been playing around with a lot of various social media’s lately and reviewing them. I have to say my favorite part about Gab is that when I post, the people who follow me actually see it. Unlike Twitter for example, where every post and comment is subjected to their unpredictable algorithms.

Smart move for Russian control. Not good for free speech although I would argue Twitter, for example is not a free speech company rather a political activist company.

https://www.reuters.com/technology/putin-signs-law-forcing-foreign-it-firms-open-offices-russia-2021-07-01/

I think this map of average mathematics science and reading scores will help explain future trajectory too… US is 25th. China is number one.

https://factsmaps.com/pisa-2018-worldwide-ranking-average-score-of-mathematics-science-reading/

In the last decade China constructed the worlds longest high speed rail network of 12k miles. IE NY to CA and back 2x. During this same decade, California has failed a 500 mile line which will complete in 2029 after China does another 18k miles. Source: Graham Allison, Destined for War

In 2011 a Chinese firm build a 30 story buildings from nothing to complete in 15 days. In 2014 a Chinese firm built a 57 story sky scraper in 19 days. China builds the square foot equivalent of today’s Rome every 2 weeks. Between 2011 and 2013 China produced and used more cement than the United States did in the entire 20th century. Meanwhile, it takes 8 months in the US to fix a public escalator and the entire state of California has failed to build a single high speed train line after years of trying.

China averages around 8% annual growth today and the US averages about 2%. It’s not hard to figure out why.

Great housing market data! The Bond King shows data that may indicate we are at peak housing prices as loan applications fall last month.

https://youtu.be/m_NQjyj6CEs

No disrespect but I disagree. You allow many characters to by typed in posts on Gab. This is an opportunity for substantive discussion and debate. Something which is not possible on Twitter.

I do think the far left, and the far right hate each other. However I think substantive debate is the answer to these problems. I think there are some issues they can agree on if presented properly. I myself am a centrist, former libertarian.

I very much enjoy talking to all people across the political spectrum with substantive debate. I may not often agree with opinions however I learn more every day.

I believe it’s important to have all people participate in free speech discussions without judgement in a format where people are allowed to produce a message which contains more substance than a bird brained 250 characters.

Dismissing someone’s claims out of hand diminishes the integrity of individual dismisser not the dismissed regardless of the validity of the original claim.

IE: Dismissing without thoughtful consideration makes you a biased hack.

Tucker made bold claims we need to all take seriously and get to the bottom of. Instead of asking for more information about this horrible invasion of personal privacy which flies in the face of our constitution, “Journalists” on the left such as political hack Kara Swisher and others dismiss the #1 cable news host’s statement without any thought or investigation.

I believe many on the left are dismissive of Tucker’s claims because:
1) If his claims turn out true, they would try to justify the spying
2) Jealous he has such good ratings
3) Abuse of the rights of those we disagree with seems to be normalized

We are all adults now... At this point im pretty sure most people who want to get vaccinated are and those who dont want to get vaccinated arnt... Can this be over yet or should I start working on a personal space suit?
If you rely on your enemy to fight, they will cut you off if they viewed you a threat or a net negative.
Opinions are temporary. When the information you have access to changes, so can your opinions.

Let me out this in perspective. How big of a betrayal this is for every person who is against big tech. If they gave $7m a year to tech startups to fight big tech, they could fund Gab. They could build out a tech server infrastructure alternative. They could build out free speech payment processors. They could build a YouTube alternative. They could actually do something to fight deplatforming. And that’s Just with the money they spent on Google and Facebook. Doesn’t account for the millions they also waste elsewhere every year.

Additionally, from personal experience, I can tell you you do not need to waste money on Google and Facebook to get to your audience. It’s a massive waste of money.

Prager U spent $3.98m on Google ads and $3.21m on Facebook ads last year. Considering they are frequently critical of Big Tech and censorship, isn’t it strange they turn around and fund them? It’s as if they care more about the attention they receive from their message rather than the consequences of their actions. There is a word in the English dictionary for this. Hypocrite.

https://projects.propublica.org/nonprofits/organizations/271763901/202140899349300004/full

Our country has a free speech crisis and this is why:

Pick a team. You must be 100% loyal on every issue, even as the positions change daily. A lack of loyalty leads to outcries of being a traitor, no matter how crazy a party position. Questioning a decision by your glorious party or leader is not allowed. Most talking heads don’t conceptualize half the things they say as long as they get attention.

Debate has been replaced with screaming. Stating opinions is debated by obscenities rather than facts. Discovering new solutions is a sinn in our new political climate unless these solutions come from a handful of prominent morons.

Our black and white world has lost all tolerance for differences in opinion and lost respect for those we disagree with. That is why most look favorably on the censorship of their political opponents and justify it with half baked propaganda.

I wonder how much equity or money Rumble had to give… The same rumble that runs entirely on Google ads. Google analytics, etc… IE big tech..

Not that I think Trump’s brand is worth anything anymore.

I issued an edit. I mistakenly said Medicare when I meant to say unemployment tax. For the record, I’m making a suggestion. Tell me what you think and why. Saying “fuck you commie” because I consider any reduction of taxes for anyone a good thing is not productive.

Why would we burden companies with a mandatory pay raise for people who cannot justify the cost to their employers when the government takes 13-25% of their paycheck? Why not let them keep that money instead of taking it from them then making private enterprise pay them more and cost many jobs.

Before we lower minimum wage could we erase all income taxes for those making under 30k a year and have the government pay for their social security and unemployment? Then we can do the minimum wage debate.

This looks very promising.

https://brave.com/brave-search-beta/
